introduction.product_vision: Create a fun, simple, and dependency-free iOS app that leverages a custom algorithm to predict the pitcher most likely to throw a no-hitter on any given day. The primary focus is on an engaging and informative user experience, particularly through robust iOS widgets.
introduction.disclaimers: This app is for entertainment and informational purposes only and is not intended for gambling. The predictions are based on statistical analysis and are not a guarantee of future outcomes. Users are solely responsible for their actions.

core_functionality.no_hitter_prediction: The app will display a single, primary prediction for the day: the pitcher most likely to throw a no-hitter.

predictive_algorithm.description: The app will use a custom-built algorithm that analyzes various historical and real-time data points.

data_points.data_point: Historical no-hitter data from public MLB data sources.
Weather conditions (temperature, humidity, wind) on dates no-hitters were thrown.
Stadium data for past no-hitters (e.g., elevation, field dimensions).
Pitcher's performance stats from their previous 3 games (e.g., strikes, hits allowed, earned run average, walk-to-hit ratio).
Batter data for the opposing team (e.g., batting average against a specific pitching style, historical performance against the predicted pitcher).

core_functionality.daily_updates: The prediction will update daily, providing a new pitcher and their details each day.

widget_support.description: The app will provide a seamless and useful experience directly on the user's home screen.
widget_support.small_widget: Displays the primary predicted pitcher's name and their team logo.
widget_support.medium_widget: Shows the predicted pitcher's name and team logo, along with key stats like their ERA and WHIP from their last 3 games.
widget_support.large_widget: Presents the most comprehensive view, including the predicted pitcher's photo, name, team, and a summary of the data points used in the algorithm (e.g., 'Stadium History: Favorable', 'Last 3 Games: Excellent ERA').

technical.no_dependencies: The app will not require a backend server, user authentication, or a database. All data for the algorithm will be pulled from publicly available sources and processed locally.
technical.data_sources: All data used to build the algorithm must be from publicly accessible MLB data sites or other verified public sources. No fake or dummy data will be used.
technical.performance: The app and its widgets must be performant, with quick loading times and minimal battery consumption.

user_experience.simplicity: The user interface (UI) will be clean and straightforward, with a focus on the daily prediction and widget configuration.
user_experience.no_monetization: The app will be a one-time purchase without any in-app purchases, subscriptions, or advertisements.
